docTitle.titlePart: A CVM Approach for Service Migration *

byline.affiliation:
State Key Laboratory of Networking and Switching Technology
Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications,

front.div:
Abstract-The road to 3G runs through 2G and 2.5G
networks. Until 3G is deployed ubiquitously, 2-2.5G networks
and endpoints will dominate. The 3G subscribers should
share the successful services deployed in the existing network
and the service migration is needed. Redesigning and
redeveloping the legacy services is a time-consuming and
error-prone task. A Connection View Model (CVM)
approach is taken to simplify the service migration. Services
represented with the CVM are platform independent and the
main task is to develop the transform rules for service
migration which can be reused. With this approach, the
successful Color Ring Back Tone (CRBT) service is migrated
to the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS).
